alert.note: Alert for Kent (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 06 at 10:47AM EDT until April 10 at 6:00AM EDT by NWS Grand Rapids
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Michigan... Grand River at Ionia affecting Ionia County. Grand River at Lansing affecting Ingham County. Grand River at Robinson Township affecting Ottawa County. Grand River at Lowell affecting Kent County. Grand River at Ada affecting Kent County. Grand River at Grand Rapids affecting Kent County. Muskegon River at Bridgeton affecting Newaygo County. Maple River at Maple Rapids affecting Clinton County. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Michigan... Sycamore Creek At Holt affecting Ingham County. Thornapple River Near Caledonia affecting Kent County. Muskegon River at Newaygo affecting Newaygo County. .One to two inches of rain has fallen during the past 36 hours and will take a few days to flow from the tributaries into the river. Generally dry weather is expected during the next week. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Thornapple River Near Caledonia. * WHEN...Until Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, High water begins to impact home on island below Cascade Dam. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM EDT Thursday the stage was 11.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:30 AM EDT Thursday was 11.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 11.9 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage Sunday evening. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.8 feet on 02/24/2018. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/grr.
